I would choose Albert Einstein because he was one of the most brilliant minds in history and his theories continue to shape our understanding of the universe. It would be fascinating to see him interact with modern society and witness his perspective on current issues.

I would bring back Marie Curie because she was a trailblazer for women in science and made significant contributions to the field of radioactivity. She was also a strong advocate for peace and it would be interesting to hear her views on current global conflicts.

I would select Mahatma Gandhi because he was a powerful symbol of non-violent resistance and civil disobedience. His teachings continue to inspire people around the world to fight for justice and equality. It would be inspiring to hear him speak about contemporary social issues.

I would bring back Martin Luther King Jr. because he was a powerful voice for racial justice and equality. He used his platform to challenge systemic racism and inspire others to fight for change. It would be inspiring to hear him speak about the ongoing struggle for racial justice in America today.

I would select Nelson Mandela because he was a symbol of hope and resilience during South Africa's apartheid era. His unwavering commitment to justice and equality inspired people around the world. It would be fascinating to hear him speak about the challenges facing South Africa today and his vision for a better future.
